body.name: BEAUTURAL Steam Iron for Clothes with Precision Thermostat Dial, Ceramic Coated Soleplate, 3-Way Auto-Off, Self-Cleaning, Anti-Calcium, Anti-Drip Blue
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 9 hrs 2 mins
features: Ceramic Coated Soleplate: Non-stick and glides over all fabric smoothly; harder than stainless steel, super scratch resistant, and more durable and easier to clean
Faster Heating: Our steam iron reaches max temperature in less than a minute, much faster than traditional irons
Easy Control Thermostat Dial: Simply select a fabric type and the iron will automatically heat to just the right temperature

Safety Comes First: This iron comes with a 3-way automatic shut-off system that automatically turns off the iron after 8 minutes if left sitting vertical and after 30 seconds if left horizontal or tipped over
All Pre-Tested: Every Iron is tested by our QA team before leaving the factory so you are assured quality right out of the box

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Note In order to ensure the quality of the product, our company's quality control staff generally uses distilled water to fully test each equipment to make sure our products work. Therefore, some residual water from testing might remain in the unit or the water tank, which is normal for the process and does not mean you have received a previously used iron. It does not influence the use of the products.If you receive the product without an intact seal, please contact service team.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Like an iron should be
reviews.reviewText: My friend bought this Beauteral iron and she couldn't stop raving about it to everyone. But I hang out with her anyway because she can read a room and she knows just the right moment to talk about ironing. SHe found it intriguing to discover that many people believe it is just not possible to have an iron that DOESN'T DRIP, LEAK, RUST, SPUTTER, or LEAVE MARKS and really, truly GETS HOT. My friend knew she had to act fast and decided to throw an Iron Party. We all had a blast getting hammered and playing Twister and getting all wrinkly and then trying out her new Beauteral on our own clothing (but not while we were still wearing it, of course, ha). Folks, this iron is AMAZING!! It's really easy to use and it's very efficient, it gets HOTT, and nope! IT DOES NOT LEAK. It really is the iron of everyone's dreams. At some point that night, the ironing pile got so huge it nearly toppled over but we just kept on stripping and ironing, stopping and ironing. Later someone brought a can of spray starch (am I even allowed to say that?) and things got real interesting ... but that iron, man, was unstoppable. The next day I ordered a Beauteral for myself (love it) plus a few more as gifts for my lucky friends. Yesss give it a go --- you won't be disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great value for the money
reviews.reviewText: I wasn't expecting much, but wasn't wanting to spend a lot of money on an iron. This iron is awesome! The steam function is as good as the expensive irons I used working as a photo stylist at a national catalog company (I ironed a lot!) It glides over fabric so well and I love the auto shut off function. For the reviewers who said it had water residue in it, it comes with a paper insert that said it was tested in the factory and may have some condensation. I did find the dial a bit hard to adjust at first but just needed to add a little extra pressure, after I did that it was no problem to adjust.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good first time iron: affordable, safe, does the job. Steam features ok, but confusing.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this iron after trying out four different steamers. I chose this one after looking into reviews on similar products. I purchased this one because (1) its price and discount at the time, (2) it had the highest ratings and (3) generally better reviews. The price was a major plus, and so far I haven't regretted that choice. It is a good iron. It is 1500W (so not the hottest it could be, but more than your standard iron you might pick up at the store).This iron is great for the casual user. You can set the temperature to the certain fabric you are ironing. It removed wrinkles from a pair of linen pants and a very very wrinkly dress shirt. The cord is long enough, but not the longest it could be. The weight is manageable for probably anyone. I will continue to use this iron until it gives me a reason to return or replace it. It has performed better than the steamers I used (Conair, Rowenta).Some things that set this iron apart:- it has both iron and steam functions (that can be used independently, or together).- it is affordable- it has an auto shut off feature that beeps loudly enough to hear from another room (this has already come in handy)- it heats up very quickly- it has an auto cleaning function- it comes with a thing to fill up the iron with water- it has an auto cleaning function (I tried this -- it's okay...not sure how useful this will be yet)- it advertises that it is designed for tap water--if this actually works after long-term use without generating calcium deposits, then this might be worth getting for that reason alone.Steaming:It has a steam function and a steam burst function. These are a bit confusing to use, and the instruction manual seems to contradict: it says steam can only be used at a certain temp., but there is a steam icon that is only on certain fabric temps (cotton, linen). So I am not sure if the steam and steam burst can be used effectively when the iron is set to a lower temp. for other kinds of fabrics that are synthetic or more gentle.Good to Know:- the device is tested and it has a warning that that is the reason there may be water drops in the iron when you receive it. One steamer I got had water drops in it (also no protective package or instructions), and looked as if it came used. The unit comes well packaged, so this makes me think they are in fact testing it this way and not just reselling used units. Not sure though.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: light wight, easy to handle, glides smoothly and did a good job! Glad I chose this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a great iron. The settings are easy to adjust and it’s easy to hold.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Breeze to clean
reviews.reviewText: Quick to heat up and easy to use, this iron with a ceramic finish is a breeze to clean. A practical choice for ironing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Iron is light and you can use the iron as a steamer
reviews.reviewText: This iron works well. It is light and has an amazing surge of steam. I especially enjoy the fact I can steam clothes using the iron in an upright position. This iron has replaced not only my broken iron but my steamer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have be looking for a good steam iron for quite sometime now. I searched online and decided to try this product out. It looked better in person and is excellent. I recommend this to anyone who appreciate a easy ironing experience.
Very good product! I initially thought it had a leak, but it turned out the steam knob needs to be turned off when not in use. Overall, I'm very happy with the iron and the support from the seller.

reviews.reviewerName: La plancha venía con agua antes de usarlas.La plancha venía con agua antes de usarlas.
reviews.reviewText: Al abrir la plancha me dí cuenta que tenía agua
The iron work very well I like the colour but it would be nice to have a clear part to put the water in so you can see where the level of water is at.

This is a nice iron, but it takes time for it to warm up. And the dial is a bit harder to turn to change the setting as it's under the handle.It works great and holds lots of water. The steam setting works good as well.

I really like this iron. It is easy to use and heats up quickly. I think the auto-shut-off is great in case I forget. It turns on quickly, which is excellent. I just need to tip it over to get it to heat up again. Perfect for my needs.
